Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below, with part of lotus flower in added red with faded added white outline; two white bands below; top of rim glazed; exterior: thin line near rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of head of red-haired komast with upper part of body (with simple maeander with red on chest) and left arm outstretched to right.
Curator's comments: According to Williams, the figure may be a female dancer. Lemos places this sherd in Group F of the Black Figure Komast Chalices. The chalices in this group represent the end of the style. The komasts are depicted so simply that they appear almost like stick figures, there is little to no filling ornament, incision is careless and the colour is poor and diluted.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 173, p. 327, no. 1510)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p.162 note 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1266) (phase 2)
